name: Circulation at the Origin
conclusion: The origin is a circulation for the given system of linear differential equations.

steps.statement: We are given the system of differential equations $\dot{x} = -y$ and $\dot{y} = x$. This can be written in matrix form as $X' = \begin{bmatrix} 0 & -1 \\ 1 & 0 \end{bmatrix} X$.

steps.claim: The eigenvalues of the matrix $\begin{bmatrix} 0 & -1 \\ 1 & 0 \end{bmatrix}$ are $\lambda = \pm i$.
An eigenvector corresponding to $\lambda = i$ is $V = \begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ -i \end{bmatrix}$.

missing.statement: Show the detailed steps to solve for the eigenvector given the equation $-ix - y = 0$.

steps.claim: A solution to the system is $X(t) = \alpha e^{it} \begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ -i \end{bmatrix}$.
steps.proof-method: This is a standard result in the theory of linear differential equations.

steps.claim: The real and imaginary parts of this solution are $X_{Re}(t) = \alpha \begin{bmatrix}  \cos t \\ \sin t \end{bmatrix}$ and $X_{Im}(t) = \alpha \begin{bmatrix} \sin t \\ - \cos t \end{bmatrix}$, respectively.
steps.proof-method: Expanding the complex exponential and separating real and imaginary parts.

missing.statement: Show the steps to expand $X(t) = \alpha e^{it} \begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ -i \end{bmatrix}$ and obtain the real and imaginary parts.

steps.claim: The general solution to the system is $X(t) = \alpha \begin{bmatrix}  \cos t \\ \sin t \end{bmatrix} + \beta \begin{bmatrix} \sin t \\ - \cos t \end{bmatrix}$.
steps.proof-method: The general solution is a linear combination of the real and imaginary parts of the complex solution.

steps.statement: This represents a circular circulation because it remains at a constant distance from the origin and has a period of $2\pi$.

missing.statement: Prove that the general solution represents a circular circulation. This may require showing that the solutions are ellipses with equal axes, which then implies that they are circles.
The proof should explicitly use the fact that the eigenvalues are purely imaginary to conclude that the origin is a circulation, according to the provided known results.
